page.title: 05HOLME FARM
page.content: Holme Farm is one of the largest farms in the area, and covers 308 acres. Most of this is cornfield, with some woodland, cereal, a pea crop, oil seed rape, and a little grass. They also have a herd of beef cattle and 13 suckler cows. The bulls are sold at 1 year old, and the rest at 2 years. 20+ chickens run loose around the farm, laying their eggs where they will. A public footpath runs through the farm and walkers enjoy seeing the chickens. The farmer feels that life is very hectic, and although he is more fortunate than some of his neighbours in having his own drying machinery for the corn, maintenance of this together with vet's bills can be very expensive. The bad weather this summer has been very bad for the cereal crop, which is costly to grow and harvest at best.
